tobj.interpreter¶

The TinyObj Interpreter

This module contains the Interpreter class responsible for traversing the Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) generated by the parser and converting it into a standard Python dictionary structure, which typically represents a hierarchical data format like JSON or YAML.

Classes¶

Interpreter

Converts a list of Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) nodes into a nested Python

Functions¶

main()

Example usage of the Lexer, Parser, and Interpreter to process TinyObj code.

Module Contents¶

class tobj.interpreter.Interpreter(ast: List[tobj.parser.ASTNode])[source]¶

Converts a list of Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) nodes into a nested Python dictionary, following the object hierarchy defined in the TinyObj code.

Parameters:

ast (List[ASTNode]) – The list of root-level AST nodes generated by the parser.

Variables:

  • root (Dict[str, Any]) – The resulting Python dictionary that stores the interpreted data structure.

  • current_object_path (Optional[str]) – The dot-separated path of the object currently being populated. Used to determine where properties belong.

ast: List[tobj.parser.ASTNode][source]¶
root: Dict[str, Any][source]¶
current_object_path: str | None = None[source]¶
interpret() → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Main method to traverse the AST and build the final dictionary.

Iterates through the AST nodes and dispatches handling based on node type.

Returns:

The fully constructed nested dictionary representing the interpreted TinyObj data.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

handle_object(node: tobj.parser.ObjectNode) → None[source]¶

Handles an ObjectNode (*ObjectName).

Sets the current_object_path and ensures that the corresponding nested dictionary structure exists in the root dictionary.

Parameters:

node (ObjectNode) – The ObjectNode to process.

handle_property(node: tobj.parser.PropertyNode) → None[source]¶

Handles a PropertyNode (>key value).

Adds the key-value pair to the dictionary represented by the current_object_path.

Parameters:

node (PropertyNode) – The PropertyNode to process.

Raises:

InterpreterError – If a property is encountered before any object has been defined (i.e., current_object_path is None).

tobj.interpreter.main()[source]¶

Example usage of the Lexer, Parser, and Interpreter to process TinyObj code.
